name: High Dike Plains
economy_niches: lowland grain cultivation for river markets
reed-harvests for ritual reagents and thatch
culture_adjustments: dike-guild license and seniority outrank clan primacy locally
seasonal labor migrations tied to ebb/flood cycles
contracts and tolls enforced at sluice-gates by local magistrates
practical sea-tide lore merged into Riveric speech with coastal loanwords
constraints: year-round dike maintenance required; labor shortages in lean season
ritual magics for flood augury consume scarce imported reagents
limited heavy industrial expansion due to soil and water management
notes: sluice tolls and salt-taxes are major revenue for state coffers
provincial dike overseer (appointed) holds strong local authority
lands are semi-reclaimed â€” neglect reverts parcels to marsh quickly
